member.summary: An Interface for Queries that return collections

member.name: T:Highway.Data.Interfaces.IQueryBase
member.summary: The base interface that surfaces SQL output of the Query statement

member.name: M:Highway.Data.Interfaces.IQueryBase.OutputSQLStatement(Highway.Data.Interfaces.IDataContext)
member.summary: This executes the expression against the passed in context to generate the SQL statement, but doesn't execute the IQueryable against the data context

member.returns: The SQL Statement from the Query

member.name: M:Highway.Data.Interfaces.IQuery`1.Execute(Highway.Data.Interfaces.IDataContext)
member.summary: This executes the expression in ContextQuery on the context that is passed in, resulting in a IQueryable that is returned as an IEnumerable
member.param: the data context that the query should be executed against
member.returns: The collection of that the query materialized if any

member.name: T:Highway.Data.Interceptors.InterceptorResult
member.summary: Results from any interceptor operation that gives a flag to tell the event manager to proceed to the next priority in line or not.

member.name: M:Highway.Data.Interceptors.InterceptorResult.Succeeded
member.summary: Creates a successful result that continues execution

member.name: M:Highway.Data.Interceptors.InterceptorResult.Failed(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a failure result that gives the event manager a message to log, and specifies to proceed to the next priority in line or not. The Default is False
member.param: Error message from the interceptor
Does execution of the interceptors continue ( Default is False )

member.name: P:Highway.Data.Interceptors.InterceptorResult.ContinueExecution
member.summary: A boolean flag for the event manager to decide if it will continue to process or error

member.name: P:Highway.Data.Interceptors.InterceptorResult.Message
member.summary: Error message populated in the case of failure
